intro: Kaluhaburunghos patulus, commonly known as the giant water lily, is a large aquatic plant native to tropical regions. It has broad, floating leaves that can reach up to three meters in diameter, providing shade for aquatic life. The plant features showy, white to pink flowers that bloom in the early morning and close by midday. Its roots anchor it in shallow water, while its rhizomes spread horizontally to form dense mats. Kaluhaburunghos patulus plays a vital role in aquatic ecosystems by oxygenating water and offering habitat for various species.
